messages.message:
Brian... What you coding in? PHP by chance?  I am launching a company and need some help finishing my project if you would like to help.  Specific application for small to mid size call centers using sencha js suite.

Let me know.
Paul

Brian
I am a huge fan of PHP.  Unfortunately, I will be very busy with school this fall as it is my last semester.  I may be available for the next few weeks if you need a consultant?

Let me set up a web conference so I can show what we have and get your feedback.  We can then think about the consulting arrangement.

You available later around 7:30?

Brian
Possibly, going to eat now, I'll keep you posted.
let me know, we are doing the gym thing now.  I will be available at 7:00.  Whats a good email to send web conference stuff over?

Brian
Have friends over, can we do this during business hours tomorrow?
No problem... before or after lunch will work.  I work from home.
Friday was a busy day after all.   What's your schedule look like for today?

Brian
I am out of town this week an only have access to my phone.
Let me know what your schedule looks like for next week or weekend.  We are moving fast and need development help.

Brian
Hey, week has been hectic from getting back from vacation.  How does your 4'oclock look?  Not sure if you have moved on, but if you would like to give me a call then, my number is 614-425-6054.  Send me a development server address and some code and I will look through it, email address is bjcullinan@gmail.com.  I have a lot of experience with php security and user interfaces, so I think I can help.
whats this week look like?  I had to fire my manila developer.

Brian
I should have time around 2 today, and more time the rest of the week.  I work at the helpdesk so I can talk but I have to occassionaly answer calls and help people, should we start with a phone meeting and then talk over instant message and email?
I got super busy yesterday... What does your afternoon look like today.  I have a 1 hour call at 12 and at 3.  Maybe we can fit something in between?

Brian
Sounds good to me.  12 to 3 works.
Im still on crazy calls now... alittle after 3:00 work for you?  Whats a good number?

Brian
Understandable.  After 3 should be fine also.  928-315-1123

Brian
Hey,
Just so you have this somewhere you can look it up:

voice: 928-315-1123
cell: 614-425-6054
gtalk: bjcullinan@gmail.com
aim: bjcullinan
msn: bjcullinan@live.com

Brian
Also, if you are interested in taking a look at my project, it can be found at: http://media.bjcullinan.com/.  It's constantly in the works, but that is the latest revision.  Username: admin password: tmppass for viewing the administration section.
Select Files : Brian's Media Website
media.bjcullinan.com

Brian
Paul,
I haven't seen an e-mail from you, I take it you have been busy.  I hope you can find time to get me some code this week and I can begin auditing and helping you implement a security model like OWASP.  Let me know.
-Brian

Brian
Hey,

Haven't heard from you in a while, I take it you have been busy.  The end of the semester is coming up in a month and there will be some grace period before I can find a full time job.  I am wondering if you would like to work together.  As I mentioned before, I like the Javascript technology you have been working with.  I think I could contribute a lot to you team and fully implement a security model.  I would be happy to forward you my resume, what e-mail address do you prefer?  Let me know what's going on.

-Brian

Hey Man... sorry, been busy as hell.  We are in the open enrollment portion of call center world right now and OPSTEL has taken a bit of a shift to satisfy a partner need.  Do you think NAU Helpdesk might be interested in a dashboard/reporting/OI solution?  

I am definitely interested in your help, especially once we land a deal!  Probably looking at possible contracting opportunity, then lead into employment depending on how quick we get rolling.

Three Areas I think you can help:
- Javascript json profile layout saved to database on update or change
- Password Security -> Might be going a hosted solution and will need a robust security level
- PHP to crop an animating GIF from http://radar.weather.gov/ridge/Conus/Loop/

Send me your resume, I'll share it with my partner.

Thanks Brian

Brian
Here at engineering we use OTRS and Nagios for our call center needs.  I'd like to see some documents of features and I can recommend your software if it looks like something we would use.

My resume can be found here:
https://bjcullinan.com/Share/Documents/Applications/Brian%20Cullinan.pdf

I look forward to hearing from you.

Documentation is on our website.  http://www.OpsTelServices.com.  We are still adding more content.  If you think the Contact Center could beenfit from the solution, let me know. We can setup a demo.

Paul

Brian
Sounds good.  Please give me a call after the meeting Monday and fill me in.  I actually just worked through an interesting problem last night, I added SSL authentication to my media server project and the browser wasn't obeying the "secure" flag set on the cookie which prevents it from transporting cookies over non-SSL connections.  My site is now completely compliant with rules A3 and A9 defined by OWASP http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Top_10_2010-Main.

I would be happy yo write you an authentication system or at least a template of code for you to use in your projects.
Top 10 2010-Main - OWASP
Attackers can potentially use many different paths through your application to do harm to your business or organization. Each of these paths represents a risk that may, or may not, be serious enough to warrant attention. Sometimes, these paths are trivial to find and exploit and sometimes they are e
owasp.org
Sounds good.  I just sent you a Google Docs share.  Where I am going to post development tasks.
Dude... do you know of any good PHP Encryption or Encoders to protect the source?

Brian
You're looking for a PHP obfuscator such as http://www.zend.com/en/products/guard/.  Most languages have obfuscators, but consider, rather than encrypting your code, include the source code in your business model.  A developer may want to contribute to the code, but a regular client cannot re-sell the code for profit that doesn't also benefit you.  You should find a boutique that can write you a custom EULA, this goes for about $1500, but is well worth it.  PHP is open, inherently.  There are solutions that don't include "encryption".  http://stackoverflow.com/questions/336057/best-solution-to-protect-php-code-without-encryption
PHP Encode Your Application to Protect Your Code with Zend Guard - Zend.com
Download Zend Guard, the most widely accepted PHP encryption product on the market that encodes your PHP code and protects your PHP applications from unlicensed use and reverse engineering.
zend.com
